cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then turning northwest into the Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana–Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southwest Louisiana coast near the Lake Charles/Cameron area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None posted for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None posted for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles now; forecast impact stretches from the upper Texas coast eastward across all of coastal Louisiana by mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely; hurricane-force winds possible if Laura strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Several feet of surge possible along Calcasieu Pass and into Calcasieu Lake affecting the port complex.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 4–8 inches with locally higher totals could cause fresh-water and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands; short-fused visibility reductions in squalls.
